infos.value: Let us now talk about <color=#0000ff>KO status</color> and <color=#0000ff>withdrawal from battle</color>.

If a unit's <color=#0000ff>HP drops to 0</color>, that unit will become <color=#0000ff>unable to fight (KO'd)</color>, and <color=#0000ff>a red text bubble</color> with the number 3 will appear over their head.
While this text bubble is overhead, you can <color=#0000ff>revive</color> your unit with a <color=#0000ff>Phoenix Down</color> or by using <color=#0000ff>Raise</color> magic.
However, if the unit remains KO'd <color=#0000ff>through their subsequent turns</color> and the number in the text bubble <color=#0000ff>falls to 0</color>, on the next turn...
...that unit will <color=#0000ff>withdraw</color> from battle. Please rest assured that even if the unit withdraws, they <color=#0000ff>will not disappear</color> from your possessed units.
That said, do note that withdrawn units cannot return to participate in that particular battle.
Now, then... The enemies that have gathered this time are very strong.
Please use Ayaka's abilities <color=#0000ff>Cure</color> and <color=#0000ff>Raise</color> aptly in battle while you dispatch the enemy.
